Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 1 Understand the Goal The user wants an analysis of a loan application process based on a provided event log The analysis must distinguish between strict normative violations Part 1 and desiderata Part 2 I need to identify specific cases for each category explain why and suggest interpretations justifications

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 2 Analyze the Normative Rules Part 1 Sequence Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant If Approved Finalize Documentation Close Case Ordering Rules Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment must occur before Loan Decision Inform Applicant must occur after Loan Decision If Approved Finalize Documentation must occur before Close Case If Rejected do not finalize documentation before closing the case Prohibitions Skipping activities changing the order performing Finalize Documentation after a rejection Closing the case without following the decision logic

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 3 Analyze the Desiderata Part 2 Credit Check should be completed within a short time window after the application is received within 24 hours applicant is informed promptly within 48 hours of the loan decision Follow up Call to the applicant sometime before closing the case encouraged but not strictly required Failing to adhere to these timing recommendations or skipping the follow up call is not a serious violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 4 Analyze the Event Log Case by Case Case 1 Trace Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case Timing Same day flow Jan 10 0900 to 1400 Normative Check Order Correct Logic Approved Finalize Docs before Close Yes Desiderata Check Credit Check within 24h Yes 0900 to 0930 Inform Applicant within 48h Yes 1100 to 1300 Follow up call No Conclusion Fully compliant with normative rules Deviates from Follow up call desideratum optional

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Trace Application Received Risk Assessment Credit Check Loan Decision Rejected Finalize Documentation Close Case Normative Check Order Risk Assessment 0820 happened before Credit Check 0900 Violation Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment Logic Rejected Finalize Documentation 1000 happened Violation Do not finalize documentation after rejection Desiderata Irrelevant because normative rules are broken Conclusion Major Normative Violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Trace Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case Normative Check Order Correct sequence Logic Approved Finalize Docs Jan 17 before Close Case Jan 17 Yes Desiderata Check Application Received Jan 12 0900 Credit Check Jan 14 1000 Time diff Jan 12 to Jan 14 more than 24 hours Violation Loan Decision Jan 14 1200 Inform Applicant Jan 16 1500 Time diff Jan 14 to Jan 16 2 days 3 hours more than 48 hours Violation Follow up Call No Conclusion Compliant with Normative rules Multiple Desiderata violations

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 5 Structure the Output Task 1 Normative Violations Focus on Case 2 Detail the ordering violation Risk Assessment before Credit Check Detail the logic violation Finalizing documentation after Rejection Task 2 Desiderata Deviations Focus on Case 3 and Case 1 regarding the follow up call Detail timing issues in Case 3 Credit Check more than 24h Inform more than 48h Mention missing Follow up Call in Case 1 and 3 Task 3 Interpretations Justifications Case 1 Standard efficient processing Case 2 Why the errors Perhaps a system glitch allowed Risk Assessment to start early or the agent made a mistake rejecting it then finalizing docs maybe a reversal of decision that was not logged or simple error Case 3 Why the delays Backlog weekend processing Jan 12 is Friday in 2024 Jan 14 is Sunday This explains the more than 24h delay for credit check waited for Monday work This adds good flavor to the interpretation

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: 6 Refine Content Case 2 Analysis The log explicitly mentions the violations in the notes I need to formalize this Case 3 Analysis The log mentions the timing issues Calendar Check Jan 12 2024 Friday Jan 14 2024 Sunday Credit Check on Sunday implies someone was working or it is an automated batch But the delay from Friday 0900 to Sunday 1000 is more than 24h Loan Decision Jan 14 Sunday Inform Applicant Jan 16 Tuesday Time from Decision Sun to Inform Tue is roughly 49 50 hours Is it a violation Yes strictly speaking but might be justified by weekends if the rule implies business hours The prompt says eg within 48 hours usually implying continuous time unless specified business days I will stick to the strict time calculation but offer the business day interpretation as a justification

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Self Correction Refinement during drafting For Case 3 the prompt notes explicitly state Happened more than 24 hours later just a desideratum violation For Case 2 the prompt notes explicitly state No prior Credit Check violates normative and Not allowed after rejection I must follow this classification Okay the plan is solid

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: 7 Final Polish Ensure the distinction between Normative Strict and Desiderata Recommended is clear Drafting Task 1 Normative Case 2 violates strict ordering Risk before Credit Case 2 violates business logic Finalize docs after Rejection Drafting Task 2 Desiderata Case 3 violates the 24h Credit Check window Case 3 violates the 48h Inform Applicant window Case 1 and 3 miss the Follow up Call Drafting Task 3 Justifications Case 2 Parallel processing error Or error in recording the decision was it actually approved Or error in recording the activity was it actually Archive Documentation rather than Finalize Case 3 Weekend bottleneck Friday application Sunday processing or Monday morning if we adjust interpretation Delays in communication
